title: Implementation Intentions: Strong Effects of Simple Plans
summary: Goal intentions ('I intend to reach Z') are often insufficient for action. Implementation intentions ('If situation X arises, then I will perform response Y') link a specific cue to a specific response, automating the initiation of the behavior.

effectiveness_metrics.description: Medium-to-large effect size on goal attainment compared to goal intentions alone (based on subsequent meta-analysis by Gollwitzer & Sheeran, 2006).

mechanisms.name: Cue Accessibility
mechanisms.description: The mental representation of the situational cue becomes highly activated and accessible.

mechanisms.name: Automatization
mechanisms.description: The response to the cue becomes immediate, efficient, and requires no conscious intent once the plan is set.

mechanisms.name: Cognitive Offloading
mechanisms.description: Reduces the 'decision fatigue' of deciding what to do in the moment.

actionable_strategies.name: If-Then Trigger Template
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Apply this template to any user-defined rule. The 'Trigger' can be an app open, a time of day, or a location. The 'Action' can be any micro-strategy from the library.

actionable_strategies.name: Obstacle Planning Template
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Prompt the user to identify their top distraction risk (e.g., fatigue, boredom) and pre-select a specific counter-move.
